summary: गौसिया अशरफिया फाउंडेशन के लिए एक आकर्षक चैरिटेबल सोसाइटी ऐप बनाया जा रहा है। ऐप हिंदी में होगा और फाउंडेशन की गतिविधियों, दान, और सामाजिक कार्यों को प्रदर्शित करेगा। यूज़र ने एक नई कलर पैलेट (colorhunt.co/palette/6326269d5353bf8b67dacc96) अप्लाई करने का अनुरोध किया है।
architectural_notes: App is in Hindi language targeting Indian audience for a charitable society named गौसिया अशरफिया फाउंडेशन
New color palette: #632626 (dark maroon), #9d5353 (deep red), #bf8b67 (warm tan), #dacc96 (light gold) — from colorhunt.co/palette/6326269d5353bf8b67dacc96
Admin panel required for viewing membership, donation, assistance, and contact submissions — needs authentication/access control
Admin Panel should only be accessible via hamburger menu link, opening on a separate page/route — not embedded on the homepage
known_issues: Admin Panel > Villages Tab में District Add करने पर लाल रंग का error text दिखता है — district add नहीं हो रहा
Admin Panel page has dark black background making all text invisible — likely a CSS/Tailwind class conflict or missing background color override on the admin route
Admin Panel passcode 'admin1234' is not working — login gate rejecting correct passcode, needs investigation and fix
Admin Panel > Villages Tab में गाँव जोड़ने पर error आ रहा है (Version 19 के बाद भी) — addVillage mutation failing
Foundation name is incorrectly spelled somewhere on the UI (circled by user) — needs to be corrected to the proper spelling गौसिया अशरफिया फाउंडेशन
हमसे जुड़े गाँव (VillagesSection) ड्राफ्ट में दिख रहा है लेकिन लाइव/प्रोडक्शन में नहीं दिख रहा — production build में section missing है
Admin Panel > Villages Tab में Bulk Export टैब/सेक्शन दिख नहीं रहा — Export to Excel और Export to PDF बटन absent हैं
Admin Panel > Villages Tab में Bulk Import (Excel/CSV अपलोड) काम नहीं कर रहा — file upload या processing में issue है
Admin Panel > Villages Tab में individual (Add District/Village) और Bulk Import दोनों काम नहीं कर रहे — Version 26 के बाद भी errors persist हैं

existing_features.title: Create a homepage hero section displaying the foundation name 'Gausiya Ashrafia Foundation' (गौसिया अशरफिया फाउंडेशन) prominently in Hindi and English, with a tagline, mission statement, and a call-to-action button for donations.
Create an About Us section in Hindi presenting the foundation's mission, vision, history, and core values with supporting text and icons.

Create a backend data model and API for storing donation records (donor name, amount, message, timestamp) and a frontend Donation section where users can submit a donation form with name, amount, and optional message fields.

Create a backend data model and frontend Activities & Events section displaying the foundation's charitable programs and events. Seed at least 3 example activities (e.g., food drives, education programs, medical camps) with title, description, date, and image placeholder.

Create a Contact Us section with foundation address, phone number, email, and social media links displayed in Hindi. Include a contact inquiry form (name, email, message) that stores submissions in the backend.

Apply a rich, warm Islamic/charitable visual theme using deep green and gold as primary colors, elegant Arabic-inspired decorative motifs, serif/calligraphic-style headings for Hindi text, and a consistent card-based layout throughout the app. The overall aesthetic should feel prestigious, trustworthy, and culturally resonant.

Update the entire app's color scheme to match the reference website at masjid-e-gausia-welfare-committee-9ti.caffeine.xyz. Extract the primary, secondary, accent, background, and text colors from that site and apply them consistently across all components: Header, HeroSection, AboutSection, DonationSection, ActivitiesSection, ContactSection, and Footer. Update the CSS custom properties in frontend/src/index.css and the Tailwind theme in frontend/tailwind.config.js to reflect the new palette. Ensure all interactive elements (buttons, links, cards, borders, badges) use the new color tokens. The overall visual style and typography should remain intact — only the color values should change.

Add the tagline '2011 से कौम की खिदमत में' (Serving the community since 2011) to the HeroSection component. Display it as a prominent sub-tagline or badge element beneath the foundation name or existing tagline, styled consistently with the current teal-green and gold Islamic theme (e.g., gold-colored text or a decorative badge/ribbon style).

Update the CSS custom properties in frontend/src/index.css and the Tailwind theme in frontend/tailwind.config.js to replace the current teal-green and gold palette with the new Color Hunt palette: dark maroon #632626 (primary), deep red #9d5353 (secondary), warm tan #bf8b67 (accent), and light gold/cream #dacc96 (highlight/background accent). Define these as named color tokens (e.g., 'primary', 'secondary', 'accent', 'highlight') usable throughout the app.

Apply the new color palette consistently across all frontend components — Header, HeroSection, AboutSection, DonationSection, ActivitiesSection, ContactSection, and Footer. Replace all teal-green backgrounds, borders, icon circles, badges, and buttons with the new dark maroon (#632626) and deep red (#9d5353) tones. Replace gold accents and highlights with warm tan (#bf8b67) and light gold (#dacc96). Ensure text contrast and readability are maintained throughout.

Update the DonationSection component to include a UPI payment panel displaying: (1) a UPI QR code image (generated asset) with 'Scan & Pay' heading, (2) the UPI ID '76800701@ubin' as copyable text with a copy-to-clipboard button, (3) a note listing supported apps: Paytm, Google Pay, PhonePe, and any UPI app. Style this panel consistently with the existing maroon/gold palette.

Add a Bank Details card to the DonationSection component displaying the following information with individual copy-to-clipboard buttons for each field: Account Name: Gausiya Ashrafiya Foundation, Account No.: 353901010037412, IFSC Code: UBIN0535397 (Union Bank of India). Include a bank icon in the card header. Style consistently with the maroon/gold palette.

Add a UPI QR code image asset to the Donation Section. The image should be a clean, scannable QR code graphic for UPI ID 76800701@ubin, displayed inside a white rounded card with 'SCAN & PAY' heading and the BHIM UPI branding label beneath it.

Update the AboutSection component's 'हमारे मूल्य' (Our Values) grid to include the following five additional core values as cards, each with an appropriate icon: (1) शिक्षा अभियान (Education Campaign), (2) दहेज प्रथा रोकथाम अभियान (Anti-Dowry Campaign), (3) मेडिकल हेल्प (Medical Help), (4) करियर गाइडेंस (Career Guidance), (5) मुआशरे में फैली बुराइयों को खत्म करना (Eradicating Social Evils). Each card should follow the existing card-based layout and maroon/gold color palette already established in the component.

Reset all impact statistics displayed in the ActivitiesSection component to zero. The stats block currently shows hardcoded numbers (e.g., beneficiaries helped, events held, volunteers, years of service). Set all numeric stat values to 0.

Create a new MembershipSection frontend component with a Hindi-language membership registration form. Fields: Full Name (पूरा नाम), Mobile Number (मोबाइल नंबर), Email (ईमेल, optional), City/Address (शहर/पता). On submission, call the `addMembership` backend mutation, show a success toast, and reset the form. Style consistently with the existing maroon/gold palette and card-based layout. Add this section to App.tsx between the ActivitiesSection and ContactSection.

Create a new AssistanceSection frontend component with a Hindi-language assistance request form. Fields: Full Name (पूरा नाम), Mobile Number (मोबाइल नंबर), City (शहर), Type of Assistance Needed (किस प्रकार की सहायता चाहिए — textarea). On submission, call the `addAssistanceRequest` backend mutation, show a success toast, and reset the form. Style consistently with the existing maroon/gold palette and card-based layout. Add this section to App.tsx between the MembershipSection and ContactSection.

Add React Query hooks (`useAddMembership`, `useGetMemberships`, `useAddAssistanceRequest`, `useGetAssistanceRequests`) to `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` to support the new Membership and Assistance backend endpoints.

Update the MembershipSection frontend component to add: (1) an Aadhaar Number field (आधार नंबर, 12-digit numeric validation), (2) an Address Proof file upload input (पता प्रमाण अपलोड करें) accepting image/pdf files up to 2MB, (3) an Identity Proof file upload input (पहचान प्रमाण अपलोड करें) accepting image/pdf files up to 2MB. Convert uploaded files to base64 data URIs before submitting via the useAddMembership mutation. Show filename and a remove button after file selection. Update useAddMembership hook in useQueries.ts to pass the new fields.

Create a protected Admin Panel page/section (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx). The panel should be accessible via a hidden route or a button visible only when an admin passcode (hardcoded, e.g., 'admin1234') is entered in a simple login gate. The panel displays four tabbed views: (1) Donations — table of all donation records (donor name, amount, message, timestamp), (2) Memberships — table of all membership registrations (name, mobile, email, city, aadhaar number, address proof download link, identity proof download link, timestamp), (3) Assistance Requests — table of all assistance request submissions (name, mobile, city, assistance type, timestamp), (4) Contact Inquiries — table of all contact form submissions (name, email, message, timestamp). Each tab fetches data using existing React Query hooks (useGetDonations, useGetMemberships, useGetAssistanceRequests, useGetContactInquiries). Style consistently with the maroon/gold palette. Add an 'Admin' link in the Header that opens the admin panel (hidden behind the passcode gate).

Create a site-wide Search Bar component (frontend/src/components/SearchBar.tsx) that allows users to search across app sections and content. The search input should filter/highlight matching sections (About, Activities, Donation, Membership, Assistance, Gallery, Government Schemes, Contact) and scroll to the relevant section on selection. Display search results as a dropdown overlay beneath the input. Style consistently with the existing maroon (#632626) and gold (#dacc96) palette.

Create a Gallery section component (frontend/src/components/GallerySection.tsx) that displays a responsive photo/image grid showcasing foundation events and activities. Include at least 6 placeholder gallery images with captions (e.g., food drives, medical camps, education programs). Add a section heading 'गैलेरी' (Gallery) with a decorative gold divider. Style consistently with the maroon/gold palette and card-based layout. Add this section to App.tsx between ActivitiesSection and MembershipSection.

Create a Government Schemes section component (frontend/src/components/GovernmentSchemesSection.tsx) that displays information about relevant Indian government welfare schemes (e.g., PM Awas Yojana, Ayushman Bharat, Scholarship schemes for minorities). Include at least 5 scheme cards with scheme name (in Hindi), a brief description, eligibility note, and an icon. Add a section heading 'सरकारी योजनाएं' (Government Schemes) with a decorative gold divider. Style consistently with the maroon/gold palette and card-based layout. Add this section to App.tsx between GallerySection and MembershipSection.

Update the Header component (frontend/src/components/Header.tsx) to add navigation links for Search Bar (with a search icon that toggles the search bar overlay), Gallery (गैलेरी), and Government Schemes (सरकारी योजनाएं) in the hamburger/mobile menu. Also add these links to the desktop navigation bar. Clicking each link should scroll to the respective section (using matching section IDs: #gallery, #government-schemes). Ensure the search icon in the nav toggles the SearchBar component visibility.

Add React Query hooks to `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` for the new district/village endpoints: `useGetDistricts()`, `useGetVillagesByDistrict(districtId: number | null)` (disabled when districtId is null), `useAddDistrict()` (mutation), `useAddVillage()` (mutation), `useDeleteDistrict()` (mutation), `useDeleteVillage()` (mutation). Follow the existing hook patterns in the file.

Create a new frontend component `frontend/src/components/VillagesSection.tsx` that displays an 'Associated Villages' (हमसे जुड़े गाँव) section. The UI should show: (1) a section heading 'हमसे जुड़े गाँव' with a decorative gold divider, (2) a two-level dropdown interaction: a list/grid of district buttons or cards — clicking a district card expands or reveals the list of villages under that district (accordion or inline expand pattern), (3) villages for the selected district are fetched via `useGetVillagesByDistrict` and displayed as a list of village name chips/tags inside the expanded district panel. Show a loading state while villages are being fetched. If no villages exist for a district, show 'कोई गाँव नहीं जोड़ा गया'. Style consistently with the existing maroon (#632626) / gold (#dacc96) palette and card-based layout. Add this section to `frontend/src/App.tsx` between the GovernmentSchemesSection and MembershipSection.

Extend the existing Admin Panel (`frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx`) to add a fifth tab called 'Villages' (गाँव प्रबंधन). This tab should provide a manual management interface with: (1) an 'Add District' form with a text input (district name) and a submit button that calls `useAddDistrict`, (2) an 'Add Village' form with a district selector dropdown (populated from `useGetDistricts`) and a village name text input, with a submit button that calls `useAddVillage`, (3) a list of all districts, each expandable to show its villages — each district row has a delete button (calls `useDeleteDistrict`), each village row has a delete button (calls `useDeleteVillage`). Show success/error toasts on all actions. Style consistently with the existing maroon/gold admin panel palette.

Add a navigation link 'हमसे जुड़े गाँव' to the Header component (`frontend/src/components/Header.tsx`) in both the desktop navigation bar and the hamburger/mobile menu. Clicking this link should scroll to the VillagesSection using the section id `#villages`.

Replace the existing generated UPI QR code image in the DonationSection with the user-uploaded QR code image (IMG-20260221-WA0043.jpg). Save the new image as a static asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/upi-qr-code.png and render it in the DonationSection's 'Scan & Pay' panel. The image shows the actual BHIM UPI QR code for UPI ID 76800701@ubin with Union Bank of India branding, Paytm, Google Pay, PhonePe, VYOM, and BharatQR logos. Keep the existing 'SCAN & PAY' heading, UPI ID display, and card layout unchanged.

Remove the AdminPanel component from its current inline position in App.tsx (where it renders as a section on the homepage). The AdminPanel should no longer be rendered as part of the main page layout.

Implement client-side routing (using a hash-based or path-based approach compatible with the ICP frontend setup) so that the Admin Panel is accessible at a dedicated route (e.g., /admin or #/admin). Render AdminPanel only when this route is active; otherwise render the normal homepage layout.

Update the Header component (frontend/src/components/Header.tsx) so that the 'Admin' link appears only in the hamburger/mobile menu and NOT in the desktop navigation bar. Clicking the Admin link in the hamburger menu should navigate to the admin route (e.g., /#/admin) to open the Admin Panel on its dedicated page, and close the hamburger menu. Remove any existing Admin link from the desktop nav.

Investigate and fix the error occurring in the Admin Panel > Villages tab when attempting to add a district. The red error text visible on the UI indicates the `addDistrict` mutation is failing. Diagnose whether the issue is: (1) a backend authorization/permission check rejecting the call (admin-only guard), (2) a mismatch between the frontend mutation arguments and the backend `addDistrict(name: Text)` function signature, (3) an actor initialization issue causing the mutation to fail silently, or (4) an error in the `useAddDistrict` React Query mutation hook (wrong method name, incorrect argument shape, or missing actor reference). Fix the root cause so that submitting the Add District form in the Villages tab successfully calls the backend, adds the district, invalidates the districts query, and shows a success toast instead of a red error message.

Fix the Admin Panel page (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx) which currently renders with a dark/black background that makes all text invisible. Audit the component's root container and all tab panel wrapper elements for any Tailwind dark-mode classes (e.g., `dark:bg-*`, `bg-gray-900`, `bg-black`) or CSS variable overrides (from frontend/src/index.css dark-mode block) that are being incorrectly applied. Replace all problematic background classes with explicit light-mode background colors consistent with the existing maroon/gold palette — use white or cream/light backgrounds (e.g., `bg-white`, `bg-[#fdf6e3]`, or `bg-highlight`) for the page root and card containers, and ensure all text uses dark readable colors (e.g., `text-gray-900`, `text-primary`). Verify that the fix applies to all five tabs: Donations, Memberships, Assistance Requests, Contact Inquiries, and Villages. The admin panel must be fully readable at the `#/admin` route without any black or near-black background regions obscuring text.

Diagnose and fix the 'जिला जोड़ने में समस्या हुई। कृपया पुनः प्रयास करें।' error shown in the Admin Panel > Villages tab when submitting the Add District form. The fix must address the root cause — which is most likely one of: (1) the backend `addDistrict` function has an admin-only caller check that rejects unauthenticated or non-owner calls; (2) the `useAddDistrict` mutation hook in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` passes arguments in the wrong shape or calls the wrong method name; (3) the actor reference used in the mutation is null/undefined at the time of the call. Audit the backend `addDistrict` function signature and any caller-identity guard, then audit the `useAddDistrict` hook implementation and how it obtains the actor. Ensure the mutation correctly calls `actor.addDistrict(name)` with a plain `Text` argument, that the actor is properly initialized before the call, and that any backend authorization check either passes for the admin panel user or is removed/relaxed appropriately. After the fix, submitting a district name (e.g., 'जौनपुर') in the Add District form must succeed, add the district to the backend, invalidate the districts query, show a success toast, and display the new district in the 'जिले और गाँव' list.

Fix the admin authentication flow in AdminPanel.tsx and the backend. The screenshots show two problems: (1) After logging in via Internet Identity, the panel still shows 'आपका अकाउंट एडमिन नहीं है' (your account is not admin) even though the user is authenticated — the admin role check is incorrectly rejecting a legitimate logged-in user; (2) The 'जिला जोड़ने के लिए एडमिन लॉगिन आवश्यक है' warning prevents district/village add forms from submitting. The root cause is that the frontend's isAdmin check compares the logged-in Internet Identity principal against a hardcoded owner principal stored in the backend, but the current user's principal does not match. Fix this by: (a) In the backend main.mo, remove or relax the admin-only caller identity guard on addDistrict, addVillage, deleteDistrict, and deleteVillage so that any authenticated Internet Identity principal can call these functions (no owner-principal check), OR store the first caller's principal as the admin owner on first call; (b) In AdminPanel.tsx, update the isAdmin / role-verification logic to treat any successfully logged-in Internet Identity user as admin (remove the principal comparison check), so the green 'लॉगिन हैं' banner correctly grants access and the warning message is not shown; (c) Ensure that after login the add-district and add-village form submit buttons become active and the warning messages are hidden; (d) Ensure the useAddDistrict and useAddVillage mutation hooks in useQueries.ts call the backend actor methods with the correct argument shape and that the actor is authenticated (uses the logged-in identity, not anonymous).

In the Admin Panel's 'Villages' tab (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx), add a 'Bulk Upload' section that allows the admin to upload an Excel (.xlsx, .xls) or CSV file containing district and village data. The file should follow a two-column format: Column A = District Name, Column B = Village Name. Parse the uploaded file entirely on the frontend (using a library such as SheetJS/xlsx) — do NOT route file data through the backend blob storage. For each unique district found in the file, call `useAddDistrict` to create it if it does not already exist, then call `useAddVillage` for each village row under that district. Show a progress indicator while processing, and display a summary toast on completion (e.g., 'X districts and Y villages added successfully'). Show row-level errors for any failed entries. Style the upload panel consistently with the existing maroon/gold Admin Panel palette.

In the Admin Panel's 'Villages' tab (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx), add an 'Export' section with two buttons: 'Export to Excel' and 'Export to PDF'. Both buttons should export the complete list of all districts and their associated villages fetched via `useGetDistricts` and `useGetVillagesByDistrict`. The Excel export should produce a .xlsx file with columns: District Name, Village Name (one row per village). The PDF export should produce a formatted PDF document listing districts as headings and their villages as a bulleted/indented list beneath each heading. Both exports must be generated entirely on the frontend (e.g., using SheetJS for Excel and jsPDF for PDF) without any backend changes. The exported file should be named 'villages-export.xlsx' / 'villages-export.pdf' respectively. Style the export buttons consistently with the existing maroon/gold Admin Panel palette.

Fix the Admin Panel passcode authentication gate in `frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx`. The current hardcoded passcode comparison is failing even when the correct passcode ('admin1234') is entered — likely due to a whitespace trim issue, incorrect string comparison, or the passcode value being out of sync. Audit the passcode check logic, ensure the comparison trims whitespace and uses strict string equality, and verify the hardcoded passcode value is exactly 'admin1234'. After the fix, entering 'admin1234' in the passcode field and clicking 'प्रवेश करें' must successfully unlock the Admin Panel.

Add a 'Change Passcode' (पासकोड बदलें) feature to the Admin Panel (`frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx`). Once the admin is logged in, display a 'Change Passcode' button or section (e.g., in the panel header or as a settings tab). This opens a small form with three fields: Current Passcode (वर्तमान पासकोड), New Passcode (नया पासकोड, minimum 6 characters), and Confirm New Passcode (पासकोड दोबारा दर्ज करें). On submission, validate that the current passcode matches, that the new passcode and confirmation match, and that the new passcode meets the minimum length. If valid, update the stored passcode (persisted in `localStorage` under a key such as `gaf_admin_passcode`, falling back to the hardcoded default 'admin1234' if no stored value exists). Show a success toast on successful change and a clear error message on validation failure. Style consistently with the existing maroon/gold Admin Panel palette.

Investigate and fix the unresponsive 'Add District' and 'Add Village' manual add form submit buttons in the Admin Panel > Villages tab (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx). The buttons are currently not clickable/responding to click events. Audit for: (1) a z-index or overlay element sitting on top of the buttons and intercepting pointer events (e.g., a transparent div, modal backdrop, or progress overlay left in a non-hidden state), (2) CSS pointer-events:none being applied to the buttons or a parent container, (3) a disabled={true} or disabled condition tied to a state variable (e.g., isLoading, isProcessing, isBulkUploading) that is stuck in a truthy state, (4) any conditional render or React state that hides or disables the form submit buttons. Ensure both the 'Add District' submit button and the 'Add Village' submit button are always clickable when the admin is authenticated, the input fields are non-empty, and no upload is in progress. After the fix, clicking the 'Add District' button with a district name entered must trigger the useAddDistrict mutation, and clicking 'Add Village' with a district selected and village name entered must trigger the useAddVillage mutation.

Investigate and fix the unresponsive Bulk Upload submit/process button in the Admin Panel > Villages tab (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx). The bulk upload trigger button (which starts processing the uploaded Excel/CSV file) is not responding to click events. Audit for: (1) a z-index or overlay element blocking pointer events on the bulk upload section, (2) a disabled condition tied to a state variable (e.g., isBulkProcessing, isUploading, no file selected check) that is incorrectly evaluating to true even when a file is selected, (3) CSS pointer-events:none on the button or a parent container, (4) a progress overlay rendered during a previous upload that was never dismissed and is now blocking the section. Ensure the bulk upload process button is clickable whenever a valid file has been selected by the user and no upload is currently in progress. After the fix, selecting a valid .xlsx/.xls/.csv file and clicking the process/upload button must begin parsing the file and calling the district/village mutation hooks.

Fix the 'Unauthorized: Only authenticated users can add districts' error shown in the Admin Panel > Villages tab when submitting the Add District and Add Village forms. The screenshot confirms the backend is rejecting the call with an authentication check. The fix must: (a) In backend/main.mo, remove the authenticated-caller guard on addDistrict, addVillage, deleteDistrict, and deleteVillage — these functions must accept calls from any caller (anonymous or authenticated) since the Admin Panel is already protected by the passcode gate on the frontend; (b) In frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts, ensure the useAddDistrict and useAddVillage mutation hooks obtain the actor WITHOUT requiring an authenticated Internet Identity — use the anonymous actor (or the actor instance regardless of login state) so the mutations are never blocked by identity state; (c) In frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx, remove any isAdmin / Internet Identity login requirement that gates the Add District and Add Village form submissions — the passcode gate is the only authentication layer needed. After the fix, entering a district name (e.g., 'जौनपुर') and clicking 'जिला जोड़ें' must succeed, add the district to the backend, invalidate the districts query, show a success toast, and display the new district in the list. Similarly, adding a village must succeed without any authorization error.

In the Admin Panel component (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx), correct the foundation name displayed in the panel header/branding area. The circled text currently reads 'गौस-ए-आज़म फाउंडेशन' — change it to the correct name 'गौसिया अशरफिया फाउंडेशन' (Gausiya Ashrafia Foundation). Ensure this matches the name displayed in the main site Header and HeroSection.

Investigate and fix the VillagesSection component not rendering in the production/live build while it correctly appears in the draft build. The screenshots confirm: (1) in the live tab, the 'हमसे जुड़े गाँव' section renders but shows 'अभी तक कोई जिला नहीं जोड़ा गया' — meaning the section renders but district data added in draft is not persisting/syncing to production; OR (2) the section itself is missing from the production bundle. Check whether the issue is: (a) the VillagesSection component is included in App.tsx but the production canister has stale/empty stable state (districts added via the draft environment are not present in the production canister), (b) a build/bundle difference between draft and production that causes the section to be omitted, or (c) a backend stable variable migration issue where the production canister's district/village data was reset on upgrade. Ensure that: the VillagesSection is present and rendered in App.tsx for the production route, the backend stable variables for districts and villages are correctly preserved across canister upgrades using stable var declarations, and the production canister's data is not silently reset. After the fix, the 'हमसे जुड़े गाँव' section must appear on the live site with the same district/village data visible in the draft.

Fix the 'कॉपी नहीं हो सका। कृपया मैन्युअली कॉपी करें।' (Copy failed) error shown in the DonationSection when the user taps any copy-to-clipboard button (UPI ID, Account Name, Account No., IFSC Code). The `navigator.clipboard.writeText` API may not be available in certain mobile browsers or insecure contexts. Implement a fallback copy mechanism using `document.execCommand('copy')` with a temporary `<textarea>` element when `navigator.clipboard` is unavailable or throws an error. Ensure the copy buttons on UPI ID and all three bank detail fields (Account Name, Account No., IFSC Code) succeed silently and show a success toast confirmation on mobile browsers.

Fix the 'जिला जोड़ने में समस्या हुई: Unauthorized: Only admins can add districts' error shown in the Admin Panel > Villages tab when submitting the Add District form (e.g., entering 'जौनपुर' and clicking '+ जोड़ें'). The backend `addDistrict`, `addVillage`, `deleteDistrict`, and `deleteVillage` functions must have their caller-identity / admin-only guard completely removed so they accept calls from any caller — anonymous or authenticated — since the Admin Panel is already protected by the frontend passcode gate. Additionally, ensure the `useAddDistrict` and `useAddVillage` mutation hooks in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` use the actor instance without requiring an authenticated Internet Identity. Remove any `isAdmin` or Internet Identity login check inside `AdminPanel.tsx` that gates these form submissions. After the fix, submitting a district name must succeed, add the district to the backend, invalidate the districts query, show a success toast, and display the new district in the list.

Fix the Bulk Import (बल्क डेटा आयात करें) functionality in the Admin Panel > Villages tab. The screenshot shows the import modal has a text-paste input (format: 'District: Village1, Village2, Village3') and an 'आयात करें (0 जिले)' button that shows 0 districts even after pasting valid data. Fix the parsing logic so that pasting text in the format 'जिला का नाम: गाँव1, गाँव2, गाँव3' (one district per line, colon-separated, villages comma-separated) correctly parses the district and village names, counts them, updates the button label (e.g., 'आयात करें (3 जिले)'), and on clicking the import button, sequentially calls addDistrict for each unique district and addVillage for each village under it, showing a progress indicator and a summary toast on completion.

Add the missing Export section to the Admin Panel > Villages tab (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx). The export section should contain two buttons: 'Export to Excel' (Excel में निर्यात करें) and 'Export to PDF' (PDF में निर्यात करें). The Excel export should produce a .xlsx file with columns District Name and Village Name (one row per village), using SheetJS. The PDF export should list districts as headings with their villages as an indented bullet list beneath each, using jsPDF. Both exports use data from useGetDistricts and useGetVillagesByDistrict. Name the files 'villages-export.xlsx' and 'villages-export.pdf'. Style the section consistently with the existing maroon/gold Admin Panel palette.

Update the Bulk Import section in the Admin Panel > Villages tab (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx) to support both Excel (.xlsx, .xls) and CSV file formats. Currently only a 'बल्क आयात करें (CSV)' button exists — replace it with a single file input that accepts .xlsx, .xls, and .csv files, and update the button label to 'बल्क आयात करें (Excel / CSV)'. The file parsing logic must handle both formats: use SheetJS/xlsx to parse .xlsx/.xls files (reading Column A as District Name, Column B as Village Name, one row per village), and retain the existing CSV parsing logic for .csv files. The rest of the bulk import flow (sequential addDistrict/addVillage calls, progress indicator, summary toast, row-level error display) must remain unchanged.

Fix the bulk import error in the Admin Panel > Villages tab where villages fail to import with 'जिला नहीं मिला' errors. The root cause is a race condition: villages are being added before the newly created district is confirmed and its ID is retrieved from the backend. Fix the bulk import flow so that for each district: (1) `addDistrict` is called and awaits the returned district ID, (2) only after the district ID is confirmed does the flow proceed to call `addVillage` for each village under that district using the correct districtId. Ensure sequential async processing — do not batch or parallelize district creation with village creation. After the fix, a bulk import containing one district with multiple villages must successfully add the district and all its villages without 'जिला नहीं मिला' errors.

Redesign the Admin Panel (frontend/src/components/AdminPanel.tsx) with an attractive, fully readable UI. Replace any dark/black background regions with explicit light backgrounds using the maroon/gold palette. Specifically: (1) Set the page root background to a warm cream/off-white (e.g., `bg-[#fdf6e3]` or `bg-[#faf5eb]`), (2) Use `bg-white` or `bg-[#fff8f0]` for all tab panel content areas and cards, (3) Style the tab bar with a maroon (`#632626`) background and gold/cream (`#dacc96`) text for active/selected tabs, inactive tabs in a lighter maroon tone, (4) Use `text-gray-900` or `text-[#3b1a1a]` for all body text to ensure high contrast on light backgrounds, (5) Style section headings with `text-[#632626]` (primary maroon), (6) Add subtle gold (`#dacc96`) borders and dividers between sections, (7) Style form inputs with a light cream background, maroon border on focus, and dark text, (8) Style data tables with alternating row colors (white / `#fdf6e3`), maroon header row with gold text, and subtle borders, (9) Style action buttons with maroon background and cream/gold text, with a hover state in deep red (`#9d5353`), (10) Ensure the passcode login gate screen also uses the cream/maroon palette with centered card layout. All five tabs (Donations, Memberships, Assistance Requests, Contact Inquiries, Villages) must be fully readable and visually consistent.

After fixing the canister stopped issue, perform an end-to-end verification of the Admin Panel Villages tab: (1) Manually adding a district via the 'नया जिला जोड़ें' form must succeed, show a success toast, and display the new district in the list. (2) Manually adding a village via the 'नया गाँव जोड़ें' form must succeed, show a success toast, and display the village under the correct district. (3) Bulk importing districts and villages via Excel/CSV file upload must process all rows without errors, show a progress indicator, and display a summary toast on completion. (4) The text-paste bulk import (टेक्स्ट से आयात) must correctly parse 'District: Village1, Village2' format and import all entries. Ensure all four operations work without any IC0508, authorization, or mutation errors.

new_feature_requests.summary: Foundation homepage with mission, vision, and about section in Hindi
Donation/charity section to accept or showcase donation options
Activities and events section showing foundation's charitable work
Contact us section with address, phone, and social links
Add tagline '2011 से कौम की खिदमत में' to the hero section
Apply new color palette from colorhunt.co/palette/6326269d5353bf8b67dacc96 (dark maroon #632626, deep red #9d5353, warm tan #bf8b67, light gold #dacc96) across all app components
डोनेशन सेक्शन में ऑनलाइन पेमेंट फीचर जोड़ें (UPI/card/bank transfer support)
About Us / हमारे मूल्य (Our Values) सेक्शन में नई जानकारी/मूल्य जोड़ें
Stats सेक्शन को जीरो/रीसेट करें (all statistics set to 0)
सदस्यता (Membership) फार्म जोड़ें — users can register as members of the foundation
सहायता प्राप्त करने के लिए (Help/Assistance Request) फार्म जोड़ें — users can request help/assistance from the foundation

Create a backend data model and API for storing membership registrations. The membership record should capture: full name, mobile number, email (optional), city/address, and registration timestamp. Expose a `addMembership` update call and a `getMemberships` query.

Create a backend data model and API for storing assistance/help requests. The record should capture: full name, mobile number, city, type of assistance needed (text/description), and submission timestamp. Expose an `addAssistanceRequest` update call and a `getAssistanceRequests` query.
एडमिन स्पेस (Admin Panel) क्रिएट करें — जहाँ डोनेशन, सदस्यता, सहायता अनुरोध और संपर्क फॉर्म सबमिशन देखे जा सकें
सदस्यता फॉर्म में आधार नंबर (Aadhaar Number) का कॉलम/फील्ड जोड़ें
सदस्यता फॉर्म में Address Proof और Identity Proof डॉक्यूमेंट अपलोड करने का ऑप्शन दें

Extend the backend Membership data model to include: (1) aadhaarNumber (Text field), (2) addressProofFile (optional Blob or Text storing base64-encoded file data + filename), (3) identityProofFile (optional Blob or Text storing base64-encoded file data + filename). Update the `addMembership` endpoint to accept these new fields. Also extend the Membership record type in all relevant backend queries.
सर्च बार (Search Bar) क्रिएट करें — ऐप में कंटेंट/सेक्शन सर्च करने की सुविधा
गैलेरी (Gallery) सेक्शन जोड़ें — फाउंडेशन की फोटो/इवेंट गैलेरी दिखाएं
गवर्नमेंट स्कीम (Government Schemes) सेक्शन जोड़ें — सरकारी योजनाओं की जानकारी दिखाएं
हैमबर्गर मेनू में Search Bar, Gallery और Government Schemes के नेविगेशन लिंक जोड़ें
हमसे जुड़े हुए गाँव (Associated Villages) का ड्रॉपडाउन मेनू बनाएं — पहले जिला दिखे, क्लिक करने पर उस जिले के गाँव दिखें। Admin panel में मैन्युअल रूप से जिला और गाँव जोड़ने की सुविधा हो।

Create a backend data model and API for managing districts and villages. Each District record should have: id (auto-incremented Nat), name (Text), and a list of associated village names. Each Village record should have: id (Nat), name (Text), and districtId (Nat). Expose the following endpoints: `addDistrict(name: Text): async Nat` (returns new district id), `getDistricts(): async [District]` (returns all districts), `addVillage(districtId: Nat, villageName: Text): async Nat` (returns new village id), `getVillagesByDistrict(districtId: Nat): async [Village]` (returns villages for a district), `deleteDistrict(districtId: Nat): async Bool`, `deleteVillage(villageId: Nat): async Bool`. Store data in stable variables.
UPI QR code स्कैनर इमेज को रिप्लेस करें — नया/असली QR कोड इमेज लगाएं
Admin Panel को फ्रंट पेज से हटाएं — सिर्फ हैमबर्गर मेनू में Admin लिंक रखें, क्लिक करने पर एक अलग पेज/रूट पर खुले (not inline on homepage)
हमसे जुड़े गाँव (Villages) में बल्क अपलोड का ऑप्शन जोड़ें — Excel/PDF फाइल अपलोड करके एक साथ कई जिले/गाँव जोड़े जा सकें (Admin Panel में)
हमसे जुड़े गाँव (Villages) डेटा को Excel/PDF में एक्सपोर्ट करने का ऑप्शन जोड़ें (Admin Panel में)
Admin panel passcode fix — passcode 'admin1234' not working, fix the authentication gate so correct passcode grants access
Admin panel में password reset करने का option जोड़ें — admin passcode बदलने की सुविधा
Bulk Import में Excel (.xlsx/.xls) और CSV दोनों फाइल फॉर्मेट का ऑप्शन दें — Admin Panel > Villages Tab में

The backend canister (oxgjl-hqaaa-aaaai-q6r4a-cai) is returning IC0508 error 'Canister is stopped', which causes all addDistrict, addVillage, deleteDistrict, and deleteVillage calls to fail with a replica rejection (Reject code 5). Investigate why the canister enters a stopped state and ensure the backend actor is always running and accepting calls. Review the backend main.mo for any explicit canister stop/shutdown logic, heartbeat errors, or upgrade hooks that may be halting the canister. Ensure the actor compiles cleanly without any trapping pre/post-upgrade hooks that would leave the canister stopped after a failed upgrade. Fix any such issues so the canister remains in a 'running' state and all district/village mutation calls succeed.
